revised_title: Influence of Incomplete Red or Green Blindness on Trichromatic Theory of Colour Vision
tldr: The author investigates the impact of incomplete red or green blindness on the trichromatic theory of colour vision. By analyzing the sensation curves of colour-blind individuals, the author concludes that the place of maximum luminosity travels in the case of red-blindness from Standard Scale No. 46 to 48, and in the case of green-blindness, from Standard Scale No. 52. This study helps in understanding the relationship between colour-blindness and the trichromatic theory of colour vision.
